titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to limit terms of Representatives and Senators and to place requirements on Representatives who seek election to the Senate.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1374)
Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

bill.summary: 5/26/1993--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Establishes a four-year term of office for the House of Representatives (with a two-year first term for a portion of the Members elected under the first four-year election). Limits a person to: (1) two terms as a Senator; and (2) four terms, or three four-year terms, as a Member of the House. Prohibits a Member of the House from qualifying as a Senate candidate unless he or she: (1) is in the final year of House office; or (2) has resigned from the House.
